task.title: Step 2. Configure Secure Connections to LDAP (Optional)

context.p:
You can optionally configure to use one of the following methods to make secure connections to the LDAP server:
LDAP over SSL (LDAPS) LDAPS uses SSL to encrypt LDAP connections. LDAPS the ldaps:// scheme.
StartTLS StartTLS can wrap an unencrypted connection with TLS during the connection process. This allows the same port to handle both unencrypted and encrypted connections. StartTLS uses the ldap:// scheme.

For either encryption method, if the LDAP server certificate is signed by a private Certificate Authority (CA) or not trusted by the default Java TrustStore, define the truststore file and password to use in the SDC_JAVA_OPTS environment variable.

step.cmd: In the $SDC_CONF/ldap-login.conf file, set either the useLdaps or useStartTLS property to true.
step.info: By default, both properties are false and so makes unencrypted connections to the LDAP server. If you set both properties to true, useStartTLS takes precedence.

step.cmd: Set the port property in the ldap-login.conf file as required, based on the method that you enabled:

choices.choice: useLdaps - Use the port number for secure connections, typically 636.
useStartTLS - Use the LDAP port number, typically 389.
